title: Swiss Watch Giant Navigates Trump’s Tariff Uncertainty

summary: Watch on demand a BoF Professional Masterclass that explores the topic in our latest case study, “How Brands Build Genuine Communities.”

summary: Fashion’s presence at Milan Design Week grew even bigger this year. Savvy activations by brands including Hermès, Gucci, Bottega Veneta, Loewe and Prada showed how Salone has become a ‘critical petri dish for dalliances between design and fashion,’ Dan Thawley reports.

summary: E-tailers remain committed to homeware and design objects, despite the luxury sector’s post-pandemic cooldown. Here’s how fashion and design e-tailers stay ahead of the curve.

title: Why Are There So Many Luggage Brands?
summary: Tourists have their pick of suitcases at every price point, thanks to low barriers to entry and a travel boom that’s inflated the category’s sales year after year. But amid signs demand has peaked, it’ll take more than a Shopify storefront and slick branding to succeed.

summary: Hotels and airlines are chasing aspirational vacationers willing to shell out big bucks. What happens when they stop?

summary: Capital from billionaire business moguls and Middle Eastern royals is pouring into Africa, filling a funding gap left by banks, as a new wave of ultra-luxury developments reshapes the continent’s hospitality landscape.

title: How The Estée Lauder Companies Engages Talent and Prioritises Values Amid Global Transformation
summary: The Estée Lauder Companies, which is behind global beauty brands including Bobbi Brown Cosmetics, Clinique, Jo Malone London, La Mer and Tom Ford Beauty, has new leadership driving strategic change and innovation in the workplace. BoF speaks to Pernilla Nyberg, SVP and general manager of UK & Ireland, to learn how the company is engaging and supporting its employees amid the change.

title: Unilever India’s New CEO Has to Invigorate a Sluggish Consumer Giant
summary: Often seen as the bellwether of the consumer sentiment in the world’s most-populous nation, Hindustan Unilever was dragged down by a consumption slowdown in India over the past year.

summary: Positioning art as an ‘alternative asset class’ is a losing game, writes Marc Spiegler. Plus, ‘South Park’ trolls Trump and the art world’s new Thai fixation.

title: Italian Competition Authority Hits Shein with €1 Million Greenwashing Fine

summary: The fashion group and one of its units ‘issued misleading ethical and social responsibility statements in contrast with the actual working conditions found at suppliers and subcontractors,’ Italy’s antitrust regulator said.

summary: The Business of Fashion’s new generative AI tool, trained exclusively on our deep archive of trusted journalism and intelligence, developed in partnership with Quilt AI. Today, we’re inviting our BoF Professional community to test it in beta mode.

summary: Check out this week’s new partners and openings on BoF Careers, the global marketplace for fashion and beauty talent.

summary: DIBS Beauty says it’ll be “the top-selling Ulta brand” in 2026, and that its new double-sided mascara is key to unlocking the number one spot. Is that even possible?

summary: Manufacturers in Southeast Asia are less optimistic about future growth, despite recent improvements in output, amid tariff uncertainty.

summary: Kering is proposing a significant compensation package for its new CEO, Luca de Meo, while outgoing CEO Francois-Henri Pinault will take a pay cut.

summary: New US tariffs on Indian imports are expected to significantly impact India’s exporters, potentially leading to job cuts and a shift in orders to other countries like Vietnam.

summary: Puma has appointed Andreas Hubert effective September 1 to oversee global sourcing operations.

summary: Despite a bigger-than-expected quarterly loss, Canada Goose saw a 22.4 percent  jump in first-quarter sales, exceeding revenue estimates thanks to strong US and Greater China market performance.

summary: The Dove soap maker kept its 2025 outlook, with plans to double down on beauty and personal care and spin off its ice cream business by November.

summary: Fashion and beauty professionals are rethinking what matters at work – from transparent leadership to meaningful flexibility and fair pay. Sheena Butler-Young and Sophie Soar dig into BoF Careers’ new report on what it takes to attract and retain top talent.

title: Trump Unleashes a Flurry of Trade Surprises on Eve of Deadline
summary: A 25 percent levy on Indian imports, the promise of deals for Thailand and Cambodia and a rollback on all duty exemptions for small packages were among the last minute announcements.

summary: The makeup artist and former L’Oréal Paris creative director will advise the Korean skincare brand on marketing, events and product development.

summary: An ongoing list of retail forays by beauty and wellness brands in 2025.

title: Beauty & Wellness Briefing: How brands are shifting budgets to offset tariffs, plus industry news
summary: This week, I checked in with beauty and wellness brand leaders to learn how they’re offsetting the cost of tariffs without increasing prices. Additionally, executive shakeups at Sephora, Novo Nordisk and Saltair; plus, P&G, Kering Beauté, L’Oréal Group, and Unilever report earnings.

title: Glossy+ Research: From content scaling to live-selling pivots, how emerging brands are evolving their marketing playbooks
summary: Emerging brands are reshaping their marketing with customer-created content, affiliate-driven storytelling and in-house live selling, while navigating platform challenges and attribution complexity.

title: Anthropologie launches sub-brand Maeve as a new standalone brand
summary: Today, Anthropologie is relaunching its Maeve private label as a standalone brand. The launch will come with all the bells and whistles of a standalone brand, including dedicated Maeve physical stores, dedicated Maeve social media channels, an influencer launch event and a full marketing campaign.

title: ‘I’m just trying to keep in the game’: Beauty founders react to August’s new tariff rates
summary: President Trump’s evolving tariff policy has rocked many business owners since he took office in January. On August 7, new tariff rates will go into effect for a number of trade partners. But the uncertainty caused by changing tariff policies throughout the second Trump administration has already had a domino effect on brands.

title: Glossy Pop Newsletter: Beauty’s new favorite way to launch a product? With a blank Instagram grid
summary: In 2013, Kanye West and Lady Gaga deleted their respective Twitter feeds to clear the metaphorical air for their new artistic eras — West for his new album, "Yeezus," and Lady Gaga for hers, "ARTPOP." Flash forward 12 years, and the clearing of the grid is a widely used tactic in beauty marketing, too.

title: Glossy Podcast: American Eagle’s controversy, Vogue’s AI ad, Quince’s mega-valuation — and Ty Haney’s return
summary: This week on the Glossy podcast, we break down American Eagle’s Sydney Sweeney controversy, Vogue’s first AI Guess ad and Quince’s $4.5 billion raise, plus senior reporter Sara Spruch Feiner weighs in on Ty Haney’s Outdoor Voices comeback.

title: As AI changes discovery, Nyx Professional Makeup doubles down on Roblox for brand awareness
summary: Nyx Professional Makeup takes over Roblox’s Bayside High for back-to-school, tapping into Gen Z’s virtual worlds as AI reshapes beauty discovery.

title: K-beauty darling Krave Beauty’s Liah Yoo on building an ethical supply chain amid tariff pressure, plus industry news
summary: Krave Beauty isn’t your average K-Beauty brand. Unlike the 12-step skin-care routines Korea is known for, Krave is based on streamlining one’s routine with minimal products that strengthen the skin’s barrier. CEO and co-founder Liah Yoo joins the Glossy Beauty Podcast to discuss her journey building an ethical supply chain — where everyone is treated and paid fairly — for its hero serum, Great Barrier Relief.

title: Fashion Briefing: As dupe lawsuits profilerate, brands weigh when it’s worth taking dupers to court
summary: Legal experts told Glossy that dupe lawsuits are becoming increasingly common in the fashion industry and reflect a growing concern among brands that dupes are a real threat to their livelihood.

title: Led by pro hair-care sales, L’Oréal Group reported 1.6% sales growth during the first half of the year
summary: Professional product sales won the first half for L’Oréal Group with a 4.9% sales jump. Highlights include new franchises from Kérastase — including Genesis and Gloss Absolu — as well as Metal Detox by L’Oréal Professionnel, Acidic Bonding Concentrate by Redken and Food for Soft by Matrix.

title: Exclusive: Dezi Skin is the latest influencer-founded brand to hit Sephora
summary: In the influencer world, Desi Perkins is an OG — Perkins got her start on YouTube via an accidentally viral makeup video. In 2020, she launched Dezi, an approachably priced collection of sunglasses. A year later, she introduced Dezi Skin, with just one product, a vitamin C serum called Claro Que C. Five years later, Perkins is launching the brand at Sephora — online-only, to start.

title: Savage x Fenty, Glow Recipe and K18 are 2025 Glossy Pop Awards finalists
summary: The Glossy Pop Awards recognize the best and most culturally relevant beauty and fashion products, campaigns, people and brands. This year’s finalists are increasingly focused on fostering and engaging communities, whether through personalization, social media, influencer collaborations or other innovative brand initiatives. For instance, in the Best Brand x Influencer Content Collab category, finalist Savage […]

title: Luxury Briefing: New tariffs offer relief, but headwinds remain — plus, the Lyst Index and a new influencer-creative director
summary: In this week's luxury briefing, a look at earnings from LVMH and Kering, as well as the reformatting of runway shows from their brands. Also, why TikTok educational creator Tanner Leatherstein is joining British leather bag brand Stow as creative director, and how smart glasses are winning the game.

title: Inside Unilever’s AI beauty marketing assembly line — and its implications for agencies
summary: The CPG giant has created an AI-augmented in-house production system. Could it be a template for others?

title: Procter & Gamble welcomes new CEO, anticipates reduction in staff in the face of an uncertain economy
summary: The owner of brands like Olay and Gillette reported a 2% growth in net sales for Q4 2025, with sales for the full year remaining flat. Looking ahead to 2026, the conglomerate anticipates growth in the single digits and a reduction of 7,000 members of its workforce.

title: With a new C-suite and updated products, Herbivore is priming itself for a comeback
summary: When Herbivore first hit shelves in 2011, the skin-care brand’s signature candy-colored serums seemed tailor-made for the Instagram era. But what first made the brand stand out is now table stakes in the industry. With a new executive team at the helm, Herbivore is banking it can achieve triple-digit growth in 2026.

title: Beauty & Wellness Briefing: Why Fractional executive hires are trending in beauty, plus industry news
summary: This week, I checked in with April Uchitel, CEO and founder at The Board, and Debbie Johnson, president of Premier Executive Recruiting, to better understand the fractional executive hiring trend and how it’s impacting the beauty and wellness industries. Additionally, Urban Decay and longtime setting spray manufacturer Skindinavia sever relationship, Ariana Grande’s R.E.M. beauty hires a new CEO, Phlur is acquired three years after its buzzy rebrand, and Obagi Medical skin care enters injectables with the acquisition of Novaestiq.

title: Ty Haney is back at Outdoor Voices, relaunching the activewear brand with a ‘confident, bold and sexy’ look
summary: Last weekend, Outdoor Voices turned heads on social media when it wiped its Instagram grid clean and followed just one person: Haney. Inc. reported on Haney's potential return on July 21. Today, Outdoor Voices officially announced its comeback.

title: How GuruNanda is leveraging its runaway success on TikTok Shop into an Ulta Beauty brick-and-mortar debut
summary: Oral care brand GuruNanda conquered TikTok Shop by selling millions of dollars of mouthwash, electric toothbrushes and whitening strips during the retailer’s 2024 prime. Today, CEO Puneet Nanda has refocused the company’s marketing prowess on its first specialty beauty brick-and-mortar retail launch with Ulta Beauty. Nanda sat down with Glossy to share the ups and downs of the company’s runaway success on TikTok Shop and why brick-and-mortar beauty retail is his new focus.

title: At a new LA fitness studio, pilates gets the luteal phase treatment
summary: The new Los Angeles women's-only fitness studio Folm taps into many trending wellness concepts, like workouts based around the menstrual cycle and amenities like an infrared-sauna and stylish body-care brands. But while framing a workout routine around menstrual cycles offers a way to stand out in a saturated fitness market, it also means wading into polarized political and medical territory.

title: Your Beauty Products Have Gotten More Expensive
summary: The cost of looking good is going up. Whether it’s a lip gloss that’s $3 pricier or a shampoo that’s an extra $2, beauty product prices are climbing faster than prices in the market overall.
